get.description: Returns current health status of My Pl@ntNet API and inrastructure

200.description: Success, all systems are up and running

500.description: Internal Server Error, at least one component of the infrastructure is down

get.description: Get the list of available languages (ISO 639-1)

parameters.name: lat

parameters.description: Longitude (WGS 84 decimal degrees): filter and sort projects according to geolocation
parameters.name: lon

get.description: Returns number of requests and remaining quota for your account, for the given day
Get the list of species that can be identified

parameters.description: Number of results per page. Must be used along with "page". Set to "" (empty string) to disable pagination
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: Page number starting at 1. Must be used along with "pageSize". Set to "" (empty string) to disable pagination

get.description: Returns status, details and statistics for your account
Get case studies list
Get habitats list for all case studies
Get indicators list for all case studies
Get species list for all case studies
This service allows plant identification (one request => one plant)

parameters.description: Referential in which to search the plant (use one of the available projects or "all" to get the results of the most relevant project)
parameters.name: project

parameters.description: Images URLs (all images must respresent the same plant) [max: 5 images]
parameters.name: images

parameters.description: Organs associated to images (must contains one of: leaf, flower, fruit, bark, auto. Could contains: habit, other) [max 5 organs and organs.length must be equal to images.length]
parameters.name: organs

parameters.description: If true, for each probable species, the most similar images will be returned
parameters.name: include-related-images

parameters.description: Disables "no result" in case of reject class match
parameters.name: no-reject

parameters.description: Max. number of species in identification results − a higher number increases response time
parameters.name: nb-results

parameters.description: Model type: use "kt" for new POWO / WGSRPD based floras and identification engine (2023+), "legacy" for legacy floras and identification engine (2022)
parameters.name: type

parameters.description: If true, results other than species predictions (family, genus…) will be added (slower)
parameters.name: detailed

parameters.description: Authenix access token − Authenix is an alternative way of authenticating. Use api-key unless you know what this is.
parameters.name: authenix-access-token

post.description:
This service allows plant identification (one request => one plant)
Mime: image/jpeg or image/png
Max POST size: 52428800 bytes

parameters.description: Referential in which to search the plant (use one of the available projects or "all" to get the results of the most relevant project)
parameters.name: project

parameters.description: If true, for each probable species, the most similar images will be returned
parameters.name: include-related-images

parameters.description: Disables "no result" in case of reject class match
parameters.name: no-reject

parameters.description: Max. number of species in identification results − a higher number increases response time
parameters.name: nb-results

parameters.description: Model type: use "kt" for new POWO / WGSRPD based floras and identification engine (2023+), "legacy" for legacy floras and identification engine (2022)
parameters.name: type

parameters.description: If true, results other than species predictions (family, genus…) will be added (slower)
parameters.name: detailed

parameters.description: Authenix access token − Authenix is an alternative way of authenticating. Use api-key unless you know what this is.
parameters.name: authenix-access-token

parameters.description: Images (all images must respresent the same plant) [max: 5 images]
parameters.name: images

parameters.description: Organs associated to images (must contains one of: leaf, flower, fruit, bark, auto. Could contains: habit, other) [max 5 organs and organs.length must be equal to images.length]
parameters.name: organs

get.description: Search latest created occurrences, in DarwinCore JSON format

parameters.description: Page number starting at 1; page size is 100
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Number of results to skip. Ignored if page is set
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return. Ignored if page is set
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Start timestamp in milliseconds (get it on page 0) (prevent pagination shift if new occurrences are added)
parameters.name: startTime

parameters.description: Minimum value for eventDate (date_created) in YYYY-MM-DD format
parameters.name: minEventDate

parameters.description: Maximum value for eventDate (date_created) in YYYY-MM-DD format
parameters.name: maxEventDate

parameters.description: License. Multiple values allowed separated by ,
parameters.name: license

parameters.description: If true, only returns occurrences attached to a valid scientific name (matching referential)
parameters.name: hasIdentification

parameters.description: Filter on GBIF taxon ID. Currently only works with value 0, that returns unidentified occurrences
parameters.name: taxonId

parameters.description: Filter on determination certainty - research: valid observation, casual: not valid observation
parameters.name: identificationVerificationStatus

parameters.description: If true, only returns occurrences attached to a pair of geographic coordinates
parameters.name: hasCoordinate

parameters.description: Authenix access token − Authenix is an alternative way of authenticating. Use api-key unless you know what this is.
parameters.name: authenix-access-token

parameters.description: Project to extract available species from
parameters.name: project

parameters.description: Number of results per page. Must be used along with "page". Set to "" (empty string) to disable pagination
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: Page number starting at 1. Must be used along with "pageSize". Set to "" (empty string) to disable pagination
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Return only species starting with given prefix
parameters.name: prefix

get.description: Aligns a species name on a specific Pl@ntNet taxonomic referential

parameters.description: Set to true when species name to align contains authorship
parameters.name: authorship

parameters.description: Set to true to look for synonyms as well as accepted names
parameters.name: synonyms

parameters.description: Set to true to perform a fuzzy search
parameters.name: fuzzy

get.description: Get identification results for an existing observation (for the given id)

parameters.description: Project where to search the plant (best: search in the project with the best results, all: search in all projects and do not filter the results by project)
parameters.name: project

parameters.description: If true, for each probable species, the most similar images will be returned
parameters.name: includeSimilarImages

get.description: Get a list of latest internally {created|updated|deleted} observations; intended to be periodically called by partners to stay up-to-date

parameters.description: Maximum number of results to retrieve
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: File size in pixels, in the form "3200x2400"
parameters.name: size

parameters.description: (pixel) The minimum size of a sub-query − default: network input size
parameters.name: tile_size

parameters.description: (pixel) Drive the image sampling − default: network input size / 2
parameters.name: tile_stride

parameters.description: Enable multi-scale analysis, when true tiles of different sizes will be generated according to size_factor − default: false
parameters.name: multi_scale

parameters.description: The multiplicative factor applied to 2 successive image sizes − default: sqrt(2)
parameters.name: size_factor

parameters.description: In case of multiscale, generate pyramids of tiles centered on a set of pixels − default: false
parameters.name: pyramid

parameters.description: Image type (JPEG, OCV, TIFF, SCANLINE) − default: jpeg
parameters.name: type

parameters.description: Custom set of tiles centers, in the form "100,150"
parameters.name: pixels

parameters.description: Custom set of tile sizes in pixels
parameters.name: sizes

parameters.description: Only taxa with a score higher than min_score will be considered − default: 0.1
parameters.name: min_score

parameters.description: Only taxa with a rank lower than max_rank will be considered − default: 1
parameters.name: max_rank

parameters.description: Return a global summary of the species that matched score and rank criteria − default: true
parameters.name: show_species

parameters.description: Return a global summary of the genera of the species that matched score and rank criteria − default: false
parameters.name: show_genus

parameters.description: Return a global summary of the families of the species that matched score and rank criteria − default: false
parameters.name: show_family

parameters.description: Return detailed non-plant results − default: false
parameters.name: detailed_reject

parameters.description: Image type (JPEG, OCV, TIFF, SCANLINE) − default: jpeg
parameters.name: type

parameters.description: (pixel) The minimum size of a sub-query − default: network input size
parameters.name: tile_size

parameters.description: (pixel) Drive the image sampling − default: network input size / 2
parameters.name: tile_stride

parameters.description: Enable multi-scale analysis, when true tiles of different sizes will be generated according to size_factor − default: false
parameters.name: multi_scale

parameters.description: The multiplicative factor applied to 2 successive image sizes − default: sqrt(2)
parameters.name: size_factor

parameters.description: Only taxa with a score higher than min_score will be considered − default: 0.1
parameters.name: min_score

parameters.description: Only taxa with a rank lower than max_rank will be considered − default: 1
parameters.name: max_rank

parameters.description: Return a global summary of the species that matched score and rank criteria − default: true
parameters.name: show_species

parameters.description: Return a global summary of the genera that matched score and rank criteria − default: false
parameters.name: show_genus

parameters.description: Return a global summary of the families that matched score and rank criteria − default: false
parameters.name: show_family

parameters.description: Return detailed non-plant results − default: false
parameters.name: detailed_reject

parameters.description: Do not only use finest zoom level to compute coverage − default: false
parameters.name: multi_scale_coverage

parameters.description: In case of multiscale, generate pyramids of tiles centered on a set of pixels − default: false
parameters.name: pyramid

post.description: Search latest created occurrences, in DarwinCore JSON format

parameters.description: Authenix access token − Authenix is an alternative way of authenticating. Use api-key unless you know what this is.
parameters.name: authenix-access-token

parameters.description: Page number starting at 1; page size is 100
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Number of results to skip. Ignored if page is set
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return. Ignored if page is set
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Start timestamp in milliseconds (get it on page 0) (prevent pagination shift if new occurrences are added)
parameters.name: startTime

parameters.description: Minimum value for eventDate (date_created). Can be a timestamp in milliseconds (preferred for pagination), or a day in YYYY-MM-DD format (time is then 00:00:00 UTC)

x-alternatives.description: Minimum value for eventDate (date_created). Can be a timestamp in milliseconds (preferred for pagination), or a day in YYYY-MM-DD format (time is then 00:00:00 UTC)

parameters.name: minEventDate

parameters.description: Maximum value for eventDate (date_created). Can be a timestamp in milliseconds (preferred for pagination), or a day in YYYY-MM-DD format (time is then 00:00:00 UTC)

x-alternatives.description: Maximum value for eventDate (date_created). Can be a timestamp in milliseconds (preferred for pagination), or a day in YYYY-MM-DD format (time is then 00:00:00 UTC)

parameters.name: maxEventDate

parameters.description: License. Multiple values allowed separated by ,
parameters.name: license

parameters.description: If true, only returns occurrences attached to a valid scientific name (matching referential)
parameters.name: hasIdentification

parameters.description: Filter on current probable species. Can be a single string or an array of strings

x-alternatives.description: Filter on current probable species. Can be a single string or an array of strings

parameters.name: scientificName

parameters.description: Filter on GBIF taxon key. Use 0 to return unidentified occurrences.
parameters.name: taxonKey

parameters.description: When false, matches scientific names in a case-insensitive way (slower)
parameters.name: scientificNameMatchCase

parameters.description: When false, matches scientific names without authorship − you must provide scientific names without authorship in this case
parameters.name: scientificNameMatchAuthor

parameters.description: Filter on determination certainty - research: valid observation, casual: not valid observation
parameters.name: identificationVerificationStatus

parameters.description: If true, only returns occurrences attached to a pair of geographic coordinates
parameters.name: hasCoordinate

parameters.description: GeoJSON polygon in epsg:4326, following the right-hand rule. Takes precedence over (min|max)Decimal(Long|Lat)itude
parameters.name: geometry
